creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
summary: Switch the AutoEntryScripts in nsDirectoryViewer to take ownership of error reporting

assigned_to_detail.name: bzbarsky@mit.edu
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Boris Zbarsky [:bz] (no decent commit message means r-)

comments.text:
Created attachment 8728246
Switch AutoEntryScripts in nsDirectoryViewer to take ownership of error reporting

These are both in things that get called from the event loop, so there is no one to report if we don't.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text:
Comment on attachment 8728246
Switch AutoEntryScripts in nsDirectoryViewer to take ownership of error reporting

Review of attachment 8728246:
-----------------------------------------------------------------

(In reply to Boris Zbarsky [:bz] from comment #1)
> Created attachment 8728246
> Switch AutoEntryScripts in nsDirectoryViewer to take ownership of error
> reporting
> 
> These are both in things that get called from the event loop, so there is no
> one to report if we don't.

To be clear (here and in other bugs), the legacy error reporting mechanism currently handles these things, so they're not getting dropped on the floor. I'm presuming you're aware of that, and that these comments are meant to say "we're not stepping on anyone's toes by taking ownership", but I just thought it was worth making explicit.
comments.author: bobbyholley@gmail.com

comments.text:
> To be clear (here and in other bugs), the legacy error reporting mechanism currently handles these things

Oh, because we don't have script on the stack?  That's a good point; I had in fact missed that.  I'll fix the commit messages.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
